patterns.title: Perfectionism and Self-Worth
patterns.description: The patient frequently expresses feelings of inadequacy and ties their self-worth to productivity and perfectionism. This is evident in entries from 2025-02-10, 2025-02-11, and 2025-02-13, where they mention staying late at work unnecessarily, anxiety about presentation perfection, and fear of not being perfect.

patterns.title: Anxiety and Guilt
patterns.description: The patient experiences anxiety about work tasks and guilt when attempting to set boundaries or leave work unfinished. This is seen in entries from 2025-02-11, 2025-02-14, and 2025-02-15, where they describe anxiety before a presentation, guilt after leaving work early, and fear of setting boundaries.

patterns.title: Avoidance of Imperfection
patterns.description: The patient avoids situations where they might not meet their own high standards, as shown in entries from 2025-02-12 and 2025-02-16. They replay perceived mistakes and express a realization of avoiding feelings of inadequacy.

mood_trends.mood_shift: The patient's mood shows signs of anxiety and self-criticism early in the week, with slight improvement towards the end as they begin to set boundaries and reflect on personal growth.
mood_trends.notable_times: Morning entries often show anxiety, while evening entries reflect on the day's events with self-criticism or realization.

clinical_prompts: Explore the patient's beliefs about perfectionism and its impact on their self-worth.
Discuss the patient's experience of anxiety related to work tasks and setting boundaries.
Examine the patient's fear of imperfection and how it influences their behavior.
Encourage reflection on the realization of running away from feelings of inadequacy.
Support the patient in developing healthier coping mechanisms for managing work-related stress.
strengths_observed: The patient is actively engaging in therapy and attempting to apply therapeutic homework.
They are beginning to set boundaries at work, as seen in their decision to leave work early and say no to extra projects.
concerns: The high level of self-criticism and perfectionism may lead to burnout if not addressed.
Persistent anxiety and guilt related to work and productivity should be monitored.
